Description: Create a name that helps users understand what the agent is used for.
Instructions: For example, you might want to create an agent to write an email message and name it Email Creator.

Description:
Select a model from the drop-down list.
Identifying a model for your agent provides additional information to the agent's user. For example, some LLM models perform better at high-reasoning tasks, while others are better at fast-response tasks.
Instructions: Options: Nova Pro, Nova Lite, Nova Micro, Llama 4 Maverick 17B, Llama 4 Scout 17B, Claude 3.5 Sonnet V2, Claude 3.5 Sonnet, Claude 3.7 Sonnet, Claude 4 Sonnet, Claude 4 Opus, Claude 4.5 Haiku, Claude 4.5 Sonnet, Claude 3 Haiku, GPT-5, GPT-5 mini, GPT-5 nano, GPT 4.1, GPT 4.1 mini, GPT 4.1 nano, Gemini 2.5 Flash, Gemini 2.5 Pro, Gemini 2.5 Flash-Lite, Gemini 2.0 Flash-Lite

Description: Tool iterations repeatedly refine and improve a tool by going through development cycles.
Instructions: You can choose the maximum number of tool iterations allowed per agent. The default is 0.

Description: The temperature parameter controls the randomness of an LLM's output.
Instructions: Lower values (e.g., 0.1) make responses more deterministic, while higher values (e.g., 0.8) increase creativity and variation. Specify a number between 0 to 1.

Description: System Prompt is an instruction for LLM model how it behaves, writing in natural language.
Instructions: Instructing with structured format is more appropriate. Defining role, tasks, and the details will make agent more behave expectedly.
